Physics (Thermodynamics).subject: Physics (Thermodynamics)
Physics (Thermodynamics).question: Which one of the following statement is true?
options: Temperatures differing 25° on the fahrenheit (F) scale must differ by 45° on the celsius (C) scale
Temperatures which differ by 10° on the celsius scale must differ by 18° on the Fahrenheit scale
Water at 90°C is warmer than water at 202°F
Physics (Thermodynamics).answer: Temperatures which differ by 10° on the celsius scale must differ by 18° on the Fahrenheit scale
Physics (Thermodynamics).explanation: By the relation in different temperature scales (C-0)/5 = (F-32)/9 = (K-273)/5 = (R-0)/4. We can calculate that temperature which differ by 10° on the celsius scale must differ by 18° on the fahrenheit scale.

Physics (Thermodynamics).subject: Physics (Thermodynamics)
Physics (Thermodynamics).question: Why are inner lining of hot water geysers made up of copper?
options: Copper does not react with steam
Copper is good conductor of both heat and electricity
Physics (Thermodynamics).answer: Copper is good conductor of both heat and electricity
Physics (Thermodynamics).explanation: Copper is a good conductor of both heat an electricity due to this it is used in all such appliance where quick heat transfer is required.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: A diffraction pattern is obtained using a beam of red light. Which one among the following will be the outcome, if the red light is replaced by blue light?
options: Diffraction pattern becomes broader and further apart
Diffraction pattern becomes narrower and crowded together
Physics (Optics).answer: Diffraction pattern becomes narrower and crowded together
Physics (Optics).explanation: Diffraction pattern becomes narrower and crowded together.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: As the sunlight passes through the atmosphere, the rays are scattered by tiny particles of dust, pollen, soot and other minute particulate matters present there. However, when we look up, the sky appears blue during mid-day because
options: ultraviolet and yellow component of sunlight combine
Physics (Optics).explanation: As, scattering µ 1/λ4. Since, wavelength of blue colour is least among three primary colours red, green and blue, so violet colour scattered most. The scattered light in the sky contains blue colour in plenty and therefore sky appears blue.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: Raw mangoes shrivel when pickled in brine. The phenomenon is associated with
options: increase of surface tension of fluid
decrease of surface tension of fluid
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: Raw mangoes shrivel when pickled in brine due to osmosis i.e. flow of water from higher concentration to lower concentration through a semi-permeable membrane.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: The angle of contact of water with glass is acute while that of mercury with glass is obtuse
The angle of contact of water with glass is obtuse, while that of mercury with glass is acute
Both the angle of contact of water with glass and that of mercury with glass are acute
Physics (Properties of Matter).answer: The angle of contact of water with glass is acute while that of mercury with glass is obtuse
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: For ordinary water and glass it is about 8° (acute angle) and for mercury and glass it is about 135° (obtuse angle).

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: The apparent weight of a steel sphere immersed in various liquids is measured using a spring balance. The greatest reading is obtained for the liquid
options: in which the sphere was submerged deepest
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: When a body immersed in a liquid, then the apparent weight of the body depends upon the densities of the liquids and volume of the portion of the solid immersed in liquid. So, the apparent weight of a steel sphere will be greatest for the liquid with the smallest density.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: If an object having mass of 1 kg is subjected to a force of 1 N it moves with
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: As we know, F = ma or a = F/m. \ a = 1N/1kg = 1 m/s2

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: An athlete diving off a high springboard can perform a variety of exercises in the air before entering the water below. Which one of the following parameters will remain constant during the fall?
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: When a athlete jumps from the spring board, he curls his body by rolling his arms and legs in. By doing so, he decreases moment of inertia of his body and hence angular speed increases to conserve the angular momentum, as I1 w1 = I2 w2 = constant.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: The pressure exerted on the ground by a man is greatest
options: when the lies down in the ground
when the stands on the toes of one foot
when the stands with both foot flat on the ground
all of the above yield the same pressure
Physics (Mechanics).answer: when the stands on the toes of one foot
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Pressure is normal force per unit area, therefore, for lesser value of area pressure is greatest.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: A passenger in a moving train tosses a five rupee coin. If the coin falls behind him, then the train must be moving with a uniform
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: As the passenger tosses the coin, it goes up and is in motion with the initial speed of the train but if the train is accelerated, so its speed increases. But the coin is in the air with initial speed of train, so the train slightly moves forward from the coin with the person and coin falls behind him. It happens when train is moving with accelerated motion.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: The force acting on a particle executing simple harmonic motion is
options: directly proportional to the displacement and is directed away from the mean position
inversely proportional to the displacement and is directed towards the mean position
directly proportional to the displacement and is directed towards the mean position
inversely proportional to the displacement and is directed away from the mean position
Physics (Mechanics).answer: directly proportional to the displacement and is directed towards the mean position
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: The restoring force acting on the particle is always proportional to the displacement of the particle from the equilibrium position and is always directed towards the equilibrium position.
